official-title.#text: To provide for an exchange of land between the United States and the Trinity Public Utilities District of Trinity County, California, involving a parcel of National Forest System land in Shasta-Trinity National Forest.

sponsor.#tail: introduced the following bill; which was referred to the

short-title.#text: Trinity County Land Exchange Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text: Land exchange, Trinity Public Utilities District, Trinity County, California, the Bureau of Land Management, and the Forest Service

shall convey to the Utilities District, in exchange, all right, title, and interest of the United States in and to Parcel B.

text.#text: The land exchange under this section is intended to be an equal value exchange. Except as provided in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 206 of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:206

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: . The appraisals shall be performed in conformance with the Uniform Appraisal Standards for Federal Land Acquisitions.
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Trinity County Land Exchange Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

text.#text: The values of Parcel A and Parcel B shall by determined by appraisals performed by a qualified appraiser mutually agreed to by the parties to the conveyances under
If the values of Parcel A and Parcel B are not equal, the values may be equalized through the use of a cash equalization payment. Notwithstanding

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , a cash equalization payment may be made in excess of 25 percent of the appraised value of the Parcel B.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#text: section 206(b) of the Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Federal Land Policy and Management Act of 1976/s:206/ss:b

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be deposited in the fund established under
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Trinity County Land Exchange Act of 2013/s:2/ss:c

text.#text: Any cash equalization payment received by the United States under

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall be available to the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Trinity County Land Exchange Act of 2013/s:2/ss:d/p:1

and the

. The Utilities District shall be responsible for the costs of the survey. The Federal Government and the Utilities District shall share in other administrative costs of the land exchange under this section.

text.#text: The exact acreage and legal description of Parcel A and Parcel B shall be determined by a survey satisfactory to the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: , acting through the Redding Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management, shall administer Parcel A as public land in accordance with the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall complete the conveyance of Parcel B not later than one year after the date on which the Utilities District offers to convey Parcel A to the

text.#text: For the purposes of this section:

quote.#tail: , adjacent to public land administered by the Redding Field Office of the Bureau of Land Management.

term.#tail: means the approximately 47 acres of land, known as the
means the approximately 100 acres land in the Shasta-Trinity National Forest in the State of California near the Weaverville Airport in Trinity County.
means the Trinity Public Utilities District of Trinity County, California.
